results.snippet: That’s the only thing they need to worry about… dance and have fun.” The Road to Halftime rollout followed the release of a record-breaking first-look trailer for the halftime show, filmed in Puerto Rico, offering a glimpse into the creative direction behind the upcoming performance. With Super Bowl LX approaching, the press conference marked a major milestone on the road to Bad Bunny’s takeover of the halftime stage, as anticipation continues to build for a performance set to light up Levi’s® Stadium on football’s biggest night.

decision.reasoning:
The current 58.1% Seahawks price is very close to ESPN Analytics (59.6% SEA), so there’s not an obvious mispricing to exploit right now.

The injury news is directionally favorable to Seattle (Patriots have several key “questionable” players, including QB Drake Maye listed DNP with right shoulder/illness plus Landry/Spillane), but at this stage it’s unclear whether those are true limitations vs. late-week rest/gamesmanship. Meanwhile, Seattle reportedly has a long injury list as well (14 players), and I don’t have enough detail on which are high-impact.

Finally, the broadcast listing showing Seahawks “+1” implies the betting market may have New England as a slight favorite on the spread, which conflicts with a 58% Seattle win probability and makes me cautious about buying Seahawks at this number without clearer confirmation (especially on Maye’s actual status).

Given the mixed signals and lack of a clear edge, I’m holding for more decisive pregame/inactives information.
